mods.note: -4- â€¢ /ftf Customs. The length is 1360 feet and the width is 30 feet, the total cost of the road was Rs. 41,300/-. The road is very well built on the same style as the one in Manama, with a parapet on the sea side and slipways at intervals down to the shore. It relieves the narrov/ bazaar roads from much of the traitic and al^ogltether it greatly improves the town. c Bazaars and Streets, Many of the roofs in the bazaars have been rebuilt and raised and several streets have been widened both in the bazaar and in the town itself. A contractor is employed for street cleaning and the result of his efforts has caused a very great change in the general cleanliness of the town# Drains, Several drains have been built from places in the town to the sea which carry off the surplus water from artesian wells. Municipal Election. fhe election took place some time before the Manama elections, 'i^h the exception of one member all the Mujlis are local Arabs.
